greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximum length of arithmetic progression starting at n such that each term k has tau(k) = tau(n).
comment: Implicitly, we require the difference d of the arithmetic progression to be positive.
example: For n=4, tau(n)=3 so each term of the arithmetic progression must be the square of a prime. The difference d must be odd for n+d to qualify, in which case n+2d is even and does not qualify; so a(4)=2 is an upper bound.
results.author: _Hugo van der Sanden_, Sep 21 2009, Oct 09 2009
ext: Extended to n=22 (taking advantage of A088430 for n=19) by _Hugo van der Sanden_, Jun 02 2015
